future_work_research_directions.summary: The study proposes further exploration of the effectiveness of SHAP-based and importance-value-based feature selection methods across various application domains, beyond credit card fraud detection. The authors aim to investigate these methods in other domains to assess generalizability and performance efficacy.
future_work_research_directions.potential_applications: Various application domains in machine learning beyond credit card fraud detection.
future_work_research_directions.methodological_improvements: Investigating SHAP and importance-based selection methods in larger datasets or different domains for scalability and efficiency.
future_work_research_directions.additional_notes: The study highlights the computational challenges associated with SHAP, suggesting that built-in feature importance may be more feasible for extensive datasets.
